channel.title: Problem with dropping items
channel.description:
My guess is that this has come up before to someone, so. Yes, i did search the forums, im not one of those douchebags who doesn't search before posting..
Anyway, Im using the Corby Xevolution Source.
When you drop an item, it dissapears instead of spawning on the ground.
Help? :]
(Yeah, its a stupid ass question, atleast its like 400x as all of the other questions in this topic. I mean, comon, changing thieving exp rates..?)

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:
@mrjad wrote:

idk howw, but WE CAN TRY :D, ok i know when you die in pvp you drop items, lets look at that and see what we can rip out of it :l

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“mrjad, post:10, topic:350669”][code]public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
if(playerItemsN[slot] != 0 && droppedItem != -1 && playerItems[slot] == droppedItem+1) {
//ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[slot]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[slot], playerId, false);
createGroundItem2(droppedItem, absX, absY, playerItemsN[slot]);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
updateRequired = true;
}
}

public void createGroundItem2(int itemID, int itemX, int itemY, int itemAmount) {
	outStream.createFrame(85);								// Phate: Spawn ground item
	outStream.writeByteC((itemY - 8 * mapRegionY));
	outStream.writeByteC((itemX - 8 * mapRegionX));
	outStream.createFrame(44);
	outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(itemID);
	outStream.writeWord(itemAmount);
	outStream.writeByte(0);									// x(4 MSB) y(LSB) coords
	//System.out.println("CreateGroundItem "+itemID+" "+(itemX - 8 * mapRegionX)+","+(itemY - 8 * mapRegionY)+" "+itemAmount);
}[/code]

BUT, you can’t pick it up, the items dont dissapear either :L[/quote]
Could we possibly fix that?

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:

[code]public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {

if(playerItemsN[slot] != 0 && droppedItem != -1 && playerItems[slot] == droppedItem+1) {
//ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[slot]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[slot], playerId, false);
createGroundItem2(droppedItem, absX, absY, playerItemsN[slot]);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
updateRequired = true;
}
}

public void createGroundItem2(int itemID, int itemX, int itemY, int itemAmount) {
	outStream.createFrame(85);								// Phate: Spawn ground item
	outStream.writeByteC((itemY - 8 * mapRegionY));
	outStream.writeByteC((itemX - 8 * mapRegionX));
	outStream.createFrame(44);
	outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(itemID);
	outStream.writeWord(itemAmount);
	outStream.writeByte(0);									// x(4 MSB) y(LSB) coords
	//System.out.println("CreateGroundItem "+itemID+" "+(itemX - 8 * mapRegionX)+","+(itemY - 8 * mapRegionY)+" "+itemAmount);
}[/code]

BUT, you can’t pick it up, the items dont dissapear either :L

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“mrjad, post:8, topic:350669”]yeah we could do that

what is that variable… anyway

EDIT: createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY);

i did that but nothing showed up :([/quote]

public void createGroundItem(int itemID, int itemX, int itemY, int itemAmount) { // Phate: creates item at absolute X and Y outStream.createFrame(85); // Phate: Spawn ground item outStream.writeByteC((itemY - 8 * mapRegionY)); outStream.writeByteC((itemX - 8 * mapRegionX)); outStream.createFrame(44); outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(itemID); outStream.writeWord(itemAmount); outStream.writeByte(0); // x(4 MSB) y(LSB) coords // System.out.println("CreateGroundItem "+itemID+" "+(itemX - 8 * // mapRegionX)+","+(itemY - 8 * mapRegionY)+" "+itemAmount); }

::::

createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY);

That seems to be wrong, because “c” is the amount dropped. Im guessing that means that it did drop it, but it doesnt know the amount…
It automatically knows the ID and the coords. We just need to figure out that variable. Which sadly, might be harder than it seems :S. or it might be easy. :]

Read full topic

Thats the problem, there.

Edit:

createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);

Couldn’t we just add the Var c?

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“mrjad, post:4, topic:350669”]i edited down to this but still not working ;p-ill keep trying

[code] public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is
// ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
boolean a = true;

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("jaddy")) {
                sM(
                        "You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
                        + ", it vanishes into the ground.");
                deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
                return ;
            }

if(playerName == null)
return;

if(droppedItem == 4045 && !isInJail()){
deleteItem(4045, 1);
dealDamage(15);
hitDiff = 15;
plrText = “Ouch!”;
plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
setAnimation(827);
return;
}
if ((playerItemsN[slot] != 0) && (droppedItem != -1)
&& (playerItems[slot] == droppedItem + 1)) {
for (int element : noTrade) {
}
if(destroyItem(droppedItem)) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(14171);
outStream.writeByte( 0);
outStream.writeWord(droppedItem + 1);
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(1);
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
sendFrame126(“Are you sure you want to destroy this object?”, 14174);
sendFrame126(“Yes.”, 14175);
sendFrame126(“No.”, 141756);
sendFrame126(""+GetItemName(droppedItem), 14184);
sendFrame126(getMessageA(droppedItem),14182);
sendFrame126(getMessageB(droppedItem),14183);
sendFrame164(14170);
publicDroppendItem = droppedItem;
return;
}

		// createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);
		deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
		updateRequired = true;
		savegame(false);
	}
}[/code][/quote]

Holy shit. No errors. Rep++ after i test it xD

Edit:
Items didnt show up on the ground.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

client.java:9757: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lamestarter location: class client if(lamestarter <= 10){ ^ client.java:9797: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4708, 4860); ^ client.java:9800: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4710, 4866); ^ client.java:9803: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4712, 4872); ^ client.java:9842: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4738, 4950); ^ client.java:9845: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4745, 4956); ^ client.java:9848: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4747, 4962); ^ client.java:9851: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4749, 4968); ^ client.java:9866: cannot find symbol symbol : method replaceitem2(int,int) location: class client replaceitem2(4759, 4998); ^ client.java:9901: addItem(GroundItem) in ItemHandler cannot be applied to (int,i nt,int,int,int,boolean) ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[slot] - 1, absX, absY, ^ 26 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Lol.

It’s all unadded ints- except for the last error. Thats the one i was trying to fix before, and its a douche. I edited a chain of like 15 things and it didnt work :[

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with dropping items
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:
@mrjad wrote:

replace your code with this, in client.java, and tell me if it works

[code] public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is
// ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
boolean a = true;

if(lamestarter <= 10){
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
sM(“You must wait longer than 10 minuted before being able to drop items.”);
sM(“This is to stop tranfering off starters.”);
return;
}
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Lifes Joke”)) {
sM(
“You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
return ;
}
if(playerName == null)
return;
if(droppedItem == 1543){
sM(“You cannot drop this item.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
addItem(droppedItem, playerItemsN[slot]);
return;
}
if(droppedItem == 1544){
sM(“You cannot drop this item.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
addItem(droppedItem, playerItemsN[slot]);
return;
}
if(droppedItem == 1545){
sM(“You cannot drop this item.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
addItem(droppedItem, playerItemsN[slot]);
return;
}
if(droppedItem == 1546){
sM(“You cannot drop this item.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
addItem(droppedItem, playerItemsN[slot]);
return;
}
if(droppedItem == 4708){
replaceitem2(4708, 4860);
}
if(droppedItem == 4710){
replaceitem2(4710, 4866);
}
if(droppedItem == 4712){
replaceitem2(4712, 4872);
}
if(droppedItem == 4714){
replaceitem2(4714, 4878);
}
if(droppedItem == 4716){
replaceitem2(4716, 4884);
}
if(droppedItem == 4718){
replaceitem2(4718, 4890);
}
if(droppedItem == 4720){
replaceitem2(4720, 4896);
}
if(droppedItem == 4722){
replaceitem2(4722, 4902);
}
if(droppedItem == 4724){
replaceitem2(4724, 4908);
}
if(droppedItem == 4726){
replaceitem2(4726, 4914);
}
if(droppedItem == 4728){
replaceitem2(4728, 4920);
}
if(droppedItem == 4730){
replaceitem2(4730, 4926);
}
if(droppedItem == 4732){
replaceitem2(4732, 4932);
}
if(droppedItem == 4734){
replaceitem2(4734, 4938);
}
if(droppedItem == 4736){
replaceitem2(4736, 4944);
}
if(droppedItem == 4738){
replaceitem2(4738, 4950);
}
if(droppedItem == 4745){
replaceitem2(4745, 4956);
}
if(droppedItem == 4747){
replaceitem2(4747, 4962);
}
if(droppedItem == 4749){
replaceitem2(4749, 4968);
}
if(droppedItem == 4751){
replaceitem2(4751, 4974);
}
if(droppedItem == 4753){
replaceitem2(4753, 4980);
}
if(droppedItem == 4755){
replaceitem2(4755, 4986);
}
if(droppedItem == 4757){
replaceitem2(4757, 4992);
}
if(droppedItem == 4759){
replaceitem2(4759, 4998);
}
if(droppedItem == 4045 && !isInJail()){
deleteItem(4045, 1);
dealDamage(15);
hitDiff = 15;
plrText = “Ouch!”;
plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
setAnimation(827);
return;
}
if ((playerItemsN[slot] != 0) && (droppedItem != -1)
&& (playerItems[slot] == droppedItem + 1)) {
for (int element : noTrade) {
}
if(destroyItem(droppedItem)) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(14171);
outStream.writeByte( 0);
outStream.writeWord(droppedItem + 1);
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(1);
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
sendFrame126(“Are you sure you want to destroy this object?”, 14174);
sendFrame126(“Yes.”, 14175);
sendFrame126(“No.”, 141756);
sendFrame126(”"+GetItemName(droppedItem), 14184);
sendFrame126(getMessageA(droppedItem),14182);
sendFrame126(getMessageB(droppedItem),14183);
sendFrame164(14170);
publicDroppendItem = droppedItem;
return;
}
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[slot] - 1, absX, absY,
playerItemsN[slot], playerId, false);
// createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
updateRequired = true;
savegame(false);
}
}
[/code]

Read full topic
